segment.source: A Platform Configuration Register (PCR) is a memory location in the TPM that has some unique properties.
segment.target: A Platform Configuration Register (PCR) is a memory location in the TPM that has some unique properties.

segment.source: The size of the value that can be stored in a PCR is determined by the size of a digest generated by an associated hashing algorithm.
segment.target: The size of the value that can be stored in a PCR is determined by the size of a digest generated by an associated hashing algorithm.

segment.source: A SHA-1 PCR can store 20 bytes – the size of a SHA-1 digest.
segment.target: A SHA-1 PCR can store 20 bytes – the size of a SHA-1 digest.

segment.source: Multiple PCRs associated with the same hashing algorithm are referred to as a PCR bank.
segment.target: Multiple PCRs associated with the same hashing algorithm are referred to as a PCR bank.

segment.source: To store a new value in a PCR, the existing value is extended with a new value as follows: PCRN = HASHalg( PCRN || ArgumentOfExtend )
segment.target: To store a new value in a PCR, the existing value is extended with a new value as follows: PCRN = HASHalg( PCRN || ArgumentOfExtend )

segment.source: The existing value is concatenated with the argument of the TPM Extend operation.
segment.target: The existing value is concatenated with the argument of the TPM Extend operation.

segment.source: The resulting concatenation is then used as input to the associated hashing algorithm, which computes a digest of the input.
segment.target: The resulting concatenation is then used as input to the associated hashing algorithm, which computes a digest of the input.

segment.source: This computed digest becomes the new value of the PCR.
segment.target: This computed digest becomes the new value of the PCR.

segment.source: The TCG PC Client Specific Platform TPM Profile for TPM 2.0 defines the inclusion of at least one PCR bank with 24 registers.
segment.target: The TCG PC Client Specific Platform TPM Profile for TPM 2.0 defines the inclusion of at least one PCR bank with 24 registers.

segment.source: The only way to reset the first 16 PCRs is to reset the TPM itself.
segment.target: The only way to reset the first 16 PCRs is to reset the TPM itself.

segment.source: This restriction helps ensure that the value of those PCRs can only be modified via the TPM Extend operation.
segment.target: This restriction helps ensure that the value of those PCRs can only be modified via the TPM Extend operation.

segment.source: Some TPM PCRs are used as checksums of log events.
segment.target: Some TPM PCRs are used as checksums of log events.

segment.source: The log events are extended in the TPM as the events occur.
segment.target: The log events are extended in the TPM as the events occur.

segment.source: Later, an auditor can validate the logs by computing the expected PCR values from the log and comparing them to the PCR values of the TPM.
segment.target: Later, an auditor can validate the logs by computing the expected PCR values from the log and comparing them to the PCR values of the TPM.

segment.source: Since the first 16 TPM PCRs cannot be modified arbitrarily, a match between an expected PCR value in that range and the actual TPM PCR value provides assurance of an unmodified log.
segment.target: Since the first 16 TPM PCRs cannot be modified arbitrarily, a match between an expected PCR value in that range and the actual TPM PCR value provides assurance of an unmodified log.

segment.source: How does Windows 10 use PCRs?
segment.target: How does Windows 10 use PCRs?

segment.source: To bind the use of a TPM based key to a certain state of the PC, the key can be sealed to an expected set of PCR values.
segment.target: To bind the use of a TPM based key to a certain state of the PC, the key can be sealed to an expected set of PCR values.

segment.source: For instance, PCRs 0 through 7 have a well-defined value after the boot process – when the OS is loaded.
segment.target: For instance, PCRs 0 through 7 have a well-defined value after the boot process – when the OS is loaded.

segment.source: When the hardware, firmware, or boot loader of the machine changes, the change can be detected in the PCR values.
segment.target: When the hardware, firmware, or boot loader of the machine changes, the change can be detected in the PCR values.

segment.source: Windows 10 uses this capability to make certain cryptographic keys only available at certain times during the boot process.
segment.target: Windows 10 uses this capability to make certain cryptographic keys only available at certain times during the boot process.

segment.source: For instance, the BitLocker key can be used at a certain point in the boot, but not before or after.
segment.target: For instance, the BitLocker key can be used at a certain point in the boot, but not before or after.

segment.source: It is important to note that this binding to PCR values also includes the hashing algorithm used for the PCR.
segment.target: It is important to note that this binding to PCR values also includes the hashing algorithm used for the PCR.

segment.source: For instance, a key can be bound to a specific value of the SHA-1 PCR12, if using SHA-256 PCR banks, even with the same system configuration otherwise, the PCR values will not match.
segment.target: For instance, a key can be bound to a specific value of the SHA-1 PCR12, if using SHA-256 PCR banks, even with the same system configuration otherwise, the PCR values will not match.

segment.source: What happens when PCR banks are switched?
segment.target: What happens when PCR banks are switched?

segment.source: When the PCR banks are switched, the algorithm used to compute the hashed values stored in the PCRs during extend operations is changed.
segment.target: When the PCR banks are switched, the algorithm used to compute the hashed values stored in the PCRs during extend operations is changed.

segment.source: For the same input, each hash algorithm will return a different cryptographic signature for the same inputs.
segment.target: For the same input, each hash algorithm will return a different cryptographic signature for the same inputs.

segment.source: As a result, if the currently used PCR bank is switched all keys that have been bound to the previous PCR values will no longer work.
segment.target: As a result, if the currently used PCR bank is switched all keys that have been bound to the previous PCR values will no longer work.

segment.source: For example, if you had a key bound to the SHA-1 value of PCR12 and subsequently changed the PCR banks to SHA-256, the banks wouldn’t match, and you would be unable to use that key.
segment.target: For example, if you had a key bound to the SHA-1 value of PCR12 and subsequently changed the PCR banks to SHA-256, the banks wouldn’t match, and you would be unable to use that key.

segment.source: The BitLocker key is secured using the PCR banks and Windows 10 will not be able to unseal it if the PCR banks are switched while BitLocker is enabled.
segment.target: The BitLocker key is secured using the PCR banks and Windows 10 will not be able to unseal it if the PCR banks are switched while BitLocker is enabled.

segment.source: What can I do to switch PCRs when BitLocker is already active?
segment.target: What can I do to switch PCRs when BitLocker is already active?

segment.source: Before switching PCR banks you should suspend or disable BitLocker – or have your recovery key ready.
segment.target: Before switching PCR banks you should suspend or disable BitLocker – or have your recovery key ready.

segment.source: For steps on how to switch PCR banks on your PC, you should contact your OEM or UEFI vendor.
segment.target: For steps on how to switch PCR banks on your PC, you should contact your OEM or UEFI vendor.
